No pet is truly fearless, even {0.SimFirstName}! Each pet has its own unique fears, so watch your pets to discover what spooks them!
Like almost all pets, {0.SimFirstName} can get inexplicably obsessed about things around the house. Keep an eye on your furry companions to discover their unique interests.
{0.SimFirstName} is a Frisky Cat. They love to run around and might get particularly hyper after baths.
{0.SimFirstName} is an Active Dog. They will frequently want to run around, chase things, and nap less.
{0.SimFirstName} is a Territorial Cat. {M0.He}{F0.She} isn't very receptive to strangers.
{0.SimFirstName} is an Aggressive Dog. They will be more hostile to others around them
{0.SimFirstName} is a Cat Lover. Sims who are Cat Lovers are happiest when around cats, finding it faster to become friends with cats.
{0.SimFirstName} is a Curious Cat. Try asking them "What's That?" and watch them investigate around the house.
{0.SimFirstName} is a Sleuth Dog. They like to search around the house and can be instructed to investigate things.
{0.SimFirstName} is a Dog Lover. Sims who are Dog Lovers are happiest when around dogs, finding it faster to become friends with dogs.
{0.SimFirstName} is a Friendly Pet. Friendly pets are always happy to meet new people.
{0.SimFirstName} is a Glutton Pet. Gluttons like to eat. A lot. Very messily.
{0.SimFirstName} is a Fluffy Cat. Remember to brush their fur regularly to prevent too many hairballs.
{0.SimFirstName} is a Hairy Dog. Make sure to clean up the leftover sheddings!
{0.SimFirstName} is a Prowler. They like to go outside and chase other smaller creatures.
{0.SimFirstName} is a Hunter. They enjoy going out to hunt and dig!
{0.SimFirstName} is an Aloof Cat. They don't have any desire to be near their owners.
{0.SimFirstName} is an Independent Dog. Let them out of the house and they'll walk themselves.
{0.SimFirstName} is a Lazy Cat. They really like relaxing and unwinding.
{0.SimFirstName} is a Couch Potato. They really dislike running and will prefer to be lazy.
{0.SimFirstName} is an Affectionate Cat. They like to follow their owners around the house.
{0.SimFirstName} is a Loyal Dog. They like to stay close to their owner.
{0.SimFirstName} is a Mischievous Cat. They misbehave more often and can even be encouraged to misbehave.
{0.SimFirstName} is a Troublemaker. They're more difficult to train, and you can even encourage their misbehavior.
{0.SimFirstName} is a Playful Pet. They love toys and want to play with everything.
{0.SimFirstName} is a Skittish Cat. They like to hide under furniture and are scared of many common household objects.
{0.SimFirstName} is a Jumpy Dog. Don't spook {M0.him}{F0.her}!
{0.SimFirstName} is a Clever Cat. Rumor is that they're smart enough to have a conversation with other Sims.
{0.SimFirstName} is a Smart Dog. They're easy to train and learn things quickly.
{0.SimFirstName} is a Spoiled Cat. They rarely change their behavior when scolded.
{0.SimFirstName} is a Stubborn Dog. They rarely change their misbehaviors and don't listen when you scold them.
{0.SimFirstName} is a Talkative Cat. They like to meow a lot, and loudly!
{0.SimFirstName} is a Vocal Dog. They like making a lot of noise, especially singing!
{0.SimFirstName} is a Free Spirit. They'll often wander out at night and come back with some surprises.
{0.SimFirstName} is a Adventurous Dog. Watch out! They might return from a night out on the town with more than they had before.

Owning and running a Vet Clinic is hard work. Pets are like family to a lot of Sims, and they're trusting you to take good care of their sick furry friend. Be sure to hire skilled employees, manage your clinic properly, and level up your vet skill to succeed! \n
For more details, please check out the Vet Clinic Ownership Lesson!
To have a functioning Vet Clinic you need an Examination Table.
The Vet Clinic is open for business.

When you need a smooth, delineating line, and want to be sure of which side you're on? Railin' is the only solution. Well, it's the best solution we're sellin'.

Now for the fun part: start customizing! Directly modify the shape of your pet’s body and face by clicking and dragging on the feature you wish to customize. Change your pet’s fur length, tail or ears from the options offered in the arc menu’s catalogs, and go to town with Paint Mode located in the Pelt Markings catalog.

Welcome to The Sims 4 Create a Pet! Meow ditty woofty woof!
This lesson will provide you with a quick overview on the features available in Create a Pet. The mechanics of creating your pets is very similar to creating a human Sim, with just a few key differences: they are generally furry and tend to stand on four legs. Click the arrow to the right and come see what’s new for your fluffy buddies!
Create a Sim starts you off with a premade human Sim. To add a cat or dog to the family, click the Add Sim button to the right of your human Sim’s skewer thumbnail.

Based on the type of animal you choose, you will be presented with the dog or cat Breeds catalog to the right of your randomized starting pet. Choose the specific breed you had in mind as a starting point, or go all mutt and play with the different combos you can get by pressing the randomize button at the bottom of the screen.

To access Paint Mode for your pet, open the Coat Color / Pattern catalog from the arc menu. The button is located at the very top, next to the marking’s color swatches. Make sure to choose a worthy base coat before jumping in to paint. The Coat Color / Pattern catalog has a lot of wonderful jumping off points or you can choose the first preset to just apply a flat base color. Now just click that paint button to get started!

Looking for something a little more whimsy to decorate your pet with? Try the Stamps tab to find a host of cool fur patterns and funky designs. Last but not least is the Stencils tab which allows you to paint with precision in artist-crafted marking patterns. Play around with the Fill Bucket and multiple colors while in the Stencils tab for some crazy combinations!
When you’re done painting, go ahead and hit the return button at the top-left of the Painting Panel to return to all the other basic Create a Pet options.

Below the color wheel you’ll find our library of paintbrushes and below those you’ll find the size and rotation sliders. If you’d prefer to not paint both sides at once and you’d rather paint more of an asymmetrical pet, uncheck the Mirror Paint toggle.\n\nYou can also paint on your pet's nose by clicking the nose paint buttons next to their face in near zoom.

Having a hard time reaching or seeing a specific area to paint? Take advantage of the Pose buttons at the top of the screen. Those will get your pet to sit and give you easier access for painting its back, they’ll make your pet sit up so you can have better access to its belly or under its chin, and it will make your pet lay down and show you its belly because it’s just too darn cute.

In addition to access to all the colors of the rainbow, there’s a handy set of tools for you to use when painting your pet. Use the eyedropper to copy a specific color from your pet, use the paint bucket to fill the whole animal with a single color, and use the eraser tool for any of painting’s little woops moments. There’s also an option to adjust the opacity of your paintbrush to help with blending.

Just like you can directly push and pull to modify the shape of your pet, you can click and drag your cursor over your pet to paint any masterpiece you can imagine. The Painting Panel to the right gives you a set of base color swatches, as well as a robust color wheel to customize the color of your paintbrush exactly the way you want it. Click the square to the left of the color wheel to fine tune the hue/saturation/brightness settings manually.

In what began as a stirring series of indictments and "hot takes" in the local newspaper, the Op-Ed Column inspired an architectural movement with its long, firm, unwavering line of commentary. It will not move, and instead, will prop up any local home with its intense view points.
Perfect for beach houses, lake houses, or country houses, this fence will do nothing to protect your home from wind, sand, or floods. It does, however, do an excellent job of repelling visitors.
This wood is the most vertical of woods. It will prop your home high above the ground to keep pesky critters out of your favorite cereal boxes.
This stylish aquarium not only holds lots of fish, but you can probably stuff some socks into those nice wooden drawers. If fish had feet they'd probably be jealous!
A classic design that never goes out of style, these shingles are guaranteed to be singularly sourced from driftwood that has sat in the sun for three to seven days or more.

Are you an eclectic singleton who shuns daylight, but yearns for a stylish home exterior? If so, the Substantially Shingled Awning is designed for you! Buy one for every window in your home to reduce sunshine and increase class.

Nothing gets a pet's blood pumping like a pristine new ball. Unfortunately, these balls are not the most durable, as they're made from biodegradeable materials, so they will need to be replaced from time to time.

Crafted from the remains of the Bartholomew’s beloved yacht, this bar smells slightly of salt, and more strongly of smoke. Captain Bart offers you this sage advice: Never throw a party on a boat that involves fireworks, nectar, and a troupe of dancing llamas.

When you're on the go and the going concern of having to "go" approaches you forcefully, gently, or innocently, look no further than the Public Tinkler. Flush away the anxiety of pent up internal waterfalls and let it all out safely in public.

Lifestyle coach and synergist Shimmer Valair invites you to indulge with a sweet soak in the luxurious Glossy Copper Tub. The ionizing properties of glossy copper are sure to add shine to your hair, nails, teeth, and skin for an invigorating, more youthful look. Be envious? No. Be envied.
Take a rest on this modern creation inspired by the beds of yore. It may cost more than your great grandfather’s bed, but the mattress is undoubtedly more comfortable.
Display Grandma’s quilt as it was meant to be seen, on a bed! Delightful, nostalgic, and, most importantly, warm.

Sometimes you have a big pupper or ambitious kitty and they desire an enormous space upon which to sleep, rest, and generally laze about. The Embiggened Pet Sleep Station is perfect for such beasts. Four legs and fur required.
Your pet deserves to have a good night or good afternoon's sleep, really anytime they're tired. Next time you want them off your bed, consider a Sleepy Time Pet Bed just for them.

A bed for one is the perfect size when your heart can only contain the warmth of a single entity - yourself. Perhaps the time isn't right for you to share your affections. The Seaside Loner doesn't judge! Pull back the comforter for one.

No need not argue whether cats or dogs are better, with Mr. Woof and Mrs. Meow's bedroom set children have the freedom to choose their favorite sheets from a variety that equally represent both well loved animals.\n\nI mean really, who can resist the adorable clawed feet on this bed?
Mr. Woof and Mrs. Meow's Child Bed

Back in the days when letters were a dark, crimson red and broadly sweeping manifestos of independence were drafted on parchment, the Revolutionary Book Stowage company was formed. Still here, over 200 years later, it seeks to tuck your most precious paper backs for future rebels and readers alike.

As coastal inhabitants well know, the likelihood of a great flood is, well, low. But! It could happen! Maybe! Look not to boats or skiffs, which are cost prohibitive. Instead, float to safety on your Floatin' Shelf while enjoying a good novel!
Found by a faithful pet companion, who knows what could be inside?

Chopped fresh from the carpeted jungles of Catalonia, this cat tree tries its hardest. Unfortunately that doesn't mean much. Cats will laze about on top, and hey, at least the middle doubles as a scratching post! That's pretty cool, right?
Chopped fresh from the carpeted jungles of Catalonia, this cat tree is for those who like thinking inside the box. And climbing inside the box. And sleeping inside the box.

Chopped fresh from the carpeted jungles of Catalonia, this deluxe cat tree offers only the best in kitty comfort. They can climb, explore, and survey their territory to their heart's delight. Or sleep. Mostly sleep.

We here at Carpeted Conifers pride ourselves in selling only the finest cat trees, chopped fresh from the carpeted jungles of Catalonia, and to be honest, we' tried something new here. By waiting until the heart of winter when the cat trees had shed their fluffy, plush carpeting, we ended up with this sleek and beautiful feline funhouse.
Chopped fresh from the carpeted jungles of Catalonia, this cat tree pairs all of your cats favorite past-times together into two symbiotic spires.

Need to establish relations with your fractious feline? Having trouble keeping your bored pet entertained? Look no further than the Cat Dazzler! This simple mechanism guarantees HOURS of entertainment for your barely domesticated carnivore. All you do is shake this in front of your cat and watch it attempt to slaughter the Dazzler instead of your family. Surviving ownership of a cat has never been easier.

The Rainbow Edition Dazzler contains all the fun and security of the regular version but with a twist! Now it comes in a scintillating array of stunning colors that will bring your tiny brutal predator to new heights of excitement!
So fuzzy, so fun, and such a mess.
So fuzzy, so rainbow, and such a mess.

Dr. Magi-Heal's miracle medicines don't make themselves! Well, they pretty much do with this advanced medicine crafting station. Craft things to make your exams and surgeries easier, or pet treats with zany effects!
Dr. Budget-Bandage's medicine crafting station crafts the exact same things as Dr. Magi-Heal's more expensive model. There's nothing wrong with doing things on a budget!

Salt resistant, wind resistant, and earthquake resistant, Big Puff's Salty Chimney is sure to guide all the smoke in your house to the exterior smoothly, safely, and in an aesthetically pleasing manner.
Pigeons can be found all over the world. Often called the rats of the bird kingdom, the pigeon has been unfairly maligned. It is quite majestic compared to many nonflying creatures.
This somewhat elegant bird roams coastal lands but are sometimes found inland. Its activities include fighting over trash, stealing food, and making dock workers angry.
This ebon plume belongs to crafty crow. Many chase these fine avians from their homes mistaking them for thieves. They are mistaken, crows only take what they need, and never more.
The divine duck is hard to compare to other avians. No other bird combines an incredibly low intelligence with such fine plumage. It is a good thing they breed like pigeons.
Finches are very attractive birds with their variety of colors and patterns. Many covet these as pets despite the finch's utter distaste of humanity. They are also nervous wrecks.
The colorful cardinal loves its seeds and showing off its impressive coat. While they make excellent neighbors, they are not well known for their baseball skills.
Herons are fastidious creatures, grooming themselves constantly. Known for their hunting speed and infinite patience, they can be admired with no egrets.

The Blue Jay is most known for its magnificent cerulean plumage. Less known is its intelligence and propensity to be a family bird. Yet, their baseball skill remains questionable, worse than cardinals even.
While usually prized as game birds, the male pheasant has incredible plumage. Collectors will admire their feathers while considering what to have with the rest of the bird for dinner.
Usually a frozen weather creature, it is rare to see a puffin feather around these parts. Lost on its way to a breeding colony perhaps? Or fleeing Iceland?
Parrots have a variety of beautiful feathers. Rare in these lands, these feathers are often prized more than the birds themselves. They tend not to bite and talk back.

A rare find indeed, experts thought this owl long gone from the world. Its otherworldly plumage had scientists convinced it was a stowaway from forays to a nearby planet. This will make an impressive show piece in any feather collection.
When considering the copy to sell this fine architectural piece, we were struggling describing how it juts out and holds roof like tiers in place, or…well, that seems sufficient, actually.
When considering the copy to sell this fine architectural piece, we were struggling describing how it juts out and holds roof like tiers in place, or…well, that seems sufficient, actually.
While it may never move, this crane does give a very industrial look to any location.
No pet likes the carrier. No pet. It means only bad things.
In an easy-to-maintain fabric, light to the touch. This curtain adds texture to a room with a subtle modern grunge edge.
Sometimes the simple things are the best. This classic, yet elegant item will make any room dressed for success effortlessly.
Thanks to the versatility of fabric patterns these curtains can be elegant and refined, handmade and cozy, playful and modern, or anything in-between!

Our "unleashed" (see what we did there?) version of the Bones And Paws curtains make an appearance to make any room, the best room ever. Its colorful details will cheer up even the worse of moods. Combine with Paws And Bones - Right for the complete look.

A series of paintings depicting the various key Brindletonians, all with some connection to Deadgrass Isle and the Tragedy of the Saint Bernard. Legend has it, in the earliest days of Brindleton Bay’s settlement, the citizens had no pets at all. The settlers had nothing to keep them entertained but tales of a plasma-sucking phantom that came in the night. One night, disaster struck. The Saint Bernard, a formidable ship to say the least, crashed headlong into the isle offshore and was lost to the waves. Mysteriously, lifeboats full of cats and dogs made their way to the shore, but there were no humans to be found. It is said that the Captain's ghost now roams the city at night, checking to make sure the ancestors of the pets that survived were given good homes, and that those lost in the crash are comfortably living out their nine afterlives on Deadgrass Isle.
The Tragedy of the Saint Bernard, and Other Tales from the Isle

A series of paintings depicting Brindeton Bay’s earliest days. Before their pets crashed ashore, Brindletonians had an enormous amount of free time that they spent tending to the fields and perfecting the covered bridge that overlooks Sable Square. Following the arrival of cats and dogs during the Tragedy of the Saint Bernard, the town's obsession with their new four-legged friends would lead them to erect huge monuments to cats and dogs throughout the square, and kick start a burgeoning fishing and pet food industry. Today, the town is thriving, with feline and canine influences woven directly into the community's DNA. The locals have even elected a cat as their mayor!

Time has not been kind to the epitaph on this solemn grave. Worn and rusted, no one can quite make out the full name of the pet that rests in eternal slumber here. Some sort of Captain? But how can that be?
While the individual pieces are a nice decoration for here and there, this stacked version brings height and width to your crates.
Want your crates stacked even higher than before? Well worry no more this stack of crates is waiting to be placed by you.
Crates a Million: Not So High Stack

When seeking to disrupt the highly static crate market, we sought to defy one's notions of a crate. Alas, crates are…pretty good at being crates, and not even adding an App to the process could fix it. We settled for a pun and it doesn't even work. Crates for nothing!

When seeking to disrupt the highly static crate market, we sought to defy one's notions of a crate. Alas, crates are…pretty good at being crates, and not even adding an App to the process could fix it. We settled for a pun and it doesn't even work. Crates for nothing!

Well, maybe not only that. Maybe some applicators and other thingamabobs? These containers are a modern take of your usual medical container found in vet and doctor's offices. Their squared shape makes organizing easier as they can fit in all nooks and crannies of your space.
Tired of giving your mangy mutt the same old boring snacks? Why not spice it up with a jar of Chewy Snackies! They're delicious, sweet, and paw-tastic!
Bones, bits, and long tasty sticks - your pet won't want to stop munching on these Crunchy Bits once they get their paws on it!

In essence, a masterful recapturing of two species first meeting. The serenity, the bliss, and the harmony that exist for the briefest moment before the dog realizes the cat isn't just a weird small dog, and starts chasing after it.

Do you need another cat? Who could even ask such a crazy question of course you do… Add cats of all types to your house with this statue, and guess what, you don't even need to feed them or pick up after them like a normal pet.

Have a favorite dog in your life? Well never fear, this ceramic dog is right there to help you fill your home with more dogs without the added responsibility. Remember to find the one that suits you best, because dogs are a Sim's best friend.
For trinkets and important instruments to make puppies and kitties feel better.
She's no retriever, but she sure is golden. Show your love for the Canis lupus familiaris by displaying this small statue prominently in your home.

Felis catus can be selfish creatures, but just because they love themselves more than they love us doesn't mean they don't bring a special something to any household. Honor that confusing codependent relationship with this small cat statue.
Two crabs got their hands on a bottle, just going for a little waddle. Bottles in hand, smiling in the sand - let's show these Sims our signs' unintelligible plans!
It's a net full of buoys. It'll probably add some nautical flair to your house. Or it'll make it smell fishy. One of those.
Avast ye! Keep the captain's prized possession away from all the landblubbers by mounting it high above deck.
This sign will let people know that you prefer dogs in your establishment. Whether they be big or small, you just want to boop the snoot and play some fetch.
This sign will let people know that only cats are welcome here. From the cutest of purrs to the sassiest of tail swishes, you just want to surround yourself with these four-legged cuties.
This sign will let locals know that you welcome their four-legged friend into your establishment. Nothing but love here.
A detail account of the canis lupus familiaris. All about each part and organ. A wonderful companion for all enthusiasts and professionals alike.
Every frame tells a story of health. No Vet office is complete without a radiography display.

So, ye need a place for yer sweet nectar and tropical juices, eh? Well keep yer treasures safe in a dark-finished barrel, suitable for an atmosphere that echoes a rough, brooding storm. Drink away ye freebooters! G'yaaaarrrrr!
A conversation piece for sure. Handcrafted from reclaimed juice barrels so it serves both a decorative and functional purpose. It will elevate any home to a rustic chic vibe.
Crates on a boat? Who could ask for more!
This catnip herb packet contains a variety of catnip flowers for planting or feeding to your cat.

You'll be thanking yourself for adorning your entryway with this practical shelf. Especially when you walk in the door with hands full and your pet welcomes you with their lovingly aggressive lick attack. Drop down that briefcase and free up your hands for cuddles and furry kisses!
You're Home! You're Home! You're Home! Entryway Shelf

Though its size pales in comparison to its big brother, Bob's Protective China Cabinet, this handsome hutch earns its keep with extra customizability options on the bottom shelf. Go ahead, fill it up!

This elegant, yet rustic dining room cabinet is perfectly stocked with the essentials for a Sunday brunch and has a shelf in the middle to decorate with whatever you please. Atop its towering body it proudly showcases Grandma's fine china safely out of reach from clumsy hands.

There were dark times before Sims figured out how to perpendicularly attach shelves to the walls of their homes. Now you too can display small clutter and other knick-knacks that require flat horizontal surfaces on the vertical faces of your walls.
This stylish wall shelf has room to hang up to four leashes or collars. If you have more than four pets you should probably re-evaluate your priorities. Or just buy another one of these.
Look left, look right, or paw forward towards adventure. Adhere to the signs, whether you can recognize their color or not to find the way.
Look left, look right, or paw forward towards adventure. Adhere to the signs, whether you can recognize their color or not to find the way.
Look left, look right, or paw forward towards adventure. Adhere to the signs, whether you can recognize their color or not to find the way.
Animal Directioning Inc: Not Barking Here!
Look left, look right, or paw forward towards adventure. Adhere to the signs, whether you can recognize their color or not to find the way.
Animal Directioning Inc: Not Pooping Here!
This blank sign is looking for the finishing touches to give it meaning. Mix and match different colors, decals, and sculptures to create a sign that is pawwfect!
A distant sibling of the "Unfulfilled Lawn Sign." This sign awaits your creativity to be displayed. Don't be afraid of trying new things! Share your message to the world!
This painted wood sign is a great base to advertise your business or place of residence. Customize it with a decal and let everyone know what your place is about!
This billboard is looking to brighten your day with prominent signage. It's spacious so it will hold any sign and decal. Use it to be informative, or just for fun.

A classic design with modern imagery, this colorful sign is sure to lure customers to your establishment. For higher profits remove the doors and keep them trapped there forever. The Grim Reaper will thank you for it.
The Last Sign You’ll Ever See
Nothing sells refinement more than an object made of wood that has a shiny interior basin.

"Fly Bayless was famous locally for annually eating ten pies in ten minutes, a truly grotesque endeavor requiring excellent hand eye coordination. Alas, a freak whittling accident cost him his left thumb and right forefinger. Unable to devour pastries with the needed speed he lost his title to his cousin Jebb."
Jebb likes pie. Jebb likes eating pie while sitting down. This chair helps Jebb eat faster, because he is sitting down. Ten pies in ten minutes. Jebb is the King of Pie Eating. Life is good for Jebb.
A formal affair requires a formal chair. Can’t afford one? Not a problem! Get a slip cover to transform any ordinary chair into an elegant creation worthy of a posh posterior.

The people have bespoken, and we understand the problem: You want a so-classic-it’s-cool dining room chair, but you’re nervous about the origin of the cushions. Where were they sourced from? Was anyone hurt procuring the materials? How many designers lost their lives fighting over the perfect pattern? Totally understandable. Worry no longer. Seriously, please calm down. This old-is-new-again-because-we-say-so chair is accompanied by only the most conflict-averse of cushions- most of them haven’t even heard someone raise their voice before!
Bespoke Dining Chair w/ Conflict-Free Cushion

Lost and Furniture’s elite team of dumpster-diving designers can’t exactly remember where or why they snatched this weave, but they do know it’s the perfect woven seat when paired with re-purposed mahogany. A delightful addition to any dining room.
Lost and Furniture Snatched Weave Dining Chair

Unsatisfied with the ottoman in your life? Maybe you’ve just been let down one too many times by an unsavory ottoman, or maybe you’ve just never met the right one. Say hello to the ottoman of your dreams: An ottoman that’ll always notice your new hairstyle, and never argue against your pick for movie night. An ottoman that is rarely late and always texts you right back. An ottoman that looks just as great in red as it does in blue, and is comfortable enough with its ottomasculinity to do so. An ottoman that would absolutely love to meet your parents, and they’ll love to meet it too. You deserve a real ottoman, so what’re you waiting for?

Nothing says coastal comfort quite like this massive plush armchair. “Coastal comfort,” it’ll whisper as you sink into its luxurious embrace. “What was that?” you’ll ask aloud, feeling foolish as you realize you’re alone in the room. “Coastal. Comfort.” the chair will repeat, louder this time. Honestly, it’s rather unsettling, so we covered it up with a cozy little blanket. Enjoy!

Living room chairs without arms? Who even has those? How terribly unusual, and frankly, unsafe. You never know when an unexpected assailant may be approaching you from either side! Feel protected from most angles when you sit in this carefully-crafted rendition of a living room staple.

Some claim that sitting in an armless chair is as hazardous as skydiving without a parachute. “There’s nothing holding you in! What if you slip!? It’s such a long way down!” Rest assured that the Completely Armless canvass covered chair is field tested and certified perfectly safe. Covering the surrounding floor with a soft batting or bubble wrap is recommended. We also suggest children and elders wear protective headgear when sitting in the chair. In fact, perhaps you should wear a mouth guard while enjoying the Completely Armless chair. Make sure to maintain a firm, upright position to avoid slipping to your doom.

Cozy up with your four-legged love on Agatha’s Cozy Two-Seater. This early American style loveseat boasts a cushy backing for the most comfortable cuddle you and your furry friends have ever embarked upon. As Agatha always says: Who needs humans when you’ve got pets?

Add some eye candy to your front yard or entryway with this lovely painted wood bench with ornate wrought iron details. We’ve found it works perfectly in the park for a moment to sit and recharge during a game of fetch. Or if you’re the type who just likes to come to the dog park and watch. Why do you do that? Maybe it’s time you adopt one. But perhaps you don’t feel ready for the responsibility? Maybe you don’t identify as a “dog person” and don’t know if now is the time to make that leap? Why sign up for all of that when I can just admire everyone else’s dogs from afar? In any case, this bench is for you.

This authentic handcrafted Winsor loveseat is a charming addition to any rustic home. Because our craftsman carved this seat from a solid block of rare catnip bacon oak, dogs and cats alike may find this handsome loveseat simply irresistible.
The Queen Bae Window Seat is the plushest and most bae window seat ever. With a comfortable seat just purrfect for furred friends, your household will quickly get in formation behind paned glass.

After years driving an oversized truck, Prometheus Van Der Sitz envisioned not a wide-load, but a wide-love…seat that is! This delicately crafted polygon for posteriors is perfect when you need a place to sit and prefer a wide berth on which to do it. Now for the outdoors!

After years driving an oversized truck, Prometheus Van Der Sitz envisioned not a wide-load, but a wide-love…seat that is! This delicately crafted polygon for posteriors is perfect when you need a place to sit and prefer a wide berth on which to do it.

This is a great couch. Covered with a clean and classic slip cover that comes in an array of rustic patterns. It’s firm yet comfortable. It’s safe. There’s just one thing missing. I think it could use a few more pillows, don’t you? There’s only what – seven pillows? I mean, we could fit at least five, six more pillows on there. Weak sauce.

Got a problem that needs some more extreme intervention? Dr. Magi-Heal's Surger-o-matic 3000 is a breakthrough in pet surgery technology! Operate on cats and dogs with his patented Cuddly-Safe technology, and perform miracles in the Vet Clinic!

Dr. Budget-Bandage’s surgery machine works just as well as Dr. Magi-Heal’s overpriced version. Sure, this one has a few paint chips and makes some weird creaky noises when in use, but that just gives it character!
This wall-mounted stereo is intended for use at community venues. These talented artists both write and sing their own music.
Purrrrfect companions are once in a lifetime occurrrrrrrences, and Big Puds is just that. Soft, fluffy, rrrrrrrobust in the softness, you will want to get your paws on Big Puds.
This gigantic canine stuffed animal modeled after a wild Estonian Poofer is not as dangerous to your home as you'd think. Give it rubs for that 10 out of 10 relationship bonus.

You'd think starting a company that only uses wood from sunken ships would have a problem with material supply. But, the Spanish lost, like, a bajillion ships to the salty depths. This lovely table takes a little bit of history - ignoring the deaths at sea - to your living room.
Yarr! Pass the salt, or the the yams, or anything tasty. It's tough to eyeball the food through this eye patch because the table itself is just such a looker. Hoo!
With four wood legs and a rounded top, sanded and painted to make it pop. The Rustic classic is will hold it all. From grilled cheese to soup, nothing will fall.
With a nail here and some wood glue there, this simple table is just begging for some chairs. It may not be the most elegant of the bunch, but when you invite guests over it is sure to pack a punch.
Circle and square this end table is not, with an octagon top to hold things taught. Two chain link handles tie into the face, to open and slide the drawers with pure grace.
Purchase the whole set to make the most pet friendly room for children. This nightstand is a perfect place for pet knick-knacks and comes in a whole swath of matching colors.
Mr. Woof and Mrs. Meow's Nightstand
Built strong and tough with natural wood. The Knotted End Table held tight where it stood. No creaking or cracking while the air grew cold, this simple end table is nothing but bold.
Rickety Rackety has many big dreams, this small and shaky table is weak it seems. Do not underestimate the build of poor Rickety, for he will prove you wrong and do it with dignity.

Step right up, doggies and kitties! What ails ya? Are you pestered by fleas? Hassled by rainbow farts? Hindered by uncontrollable drooling? We've got your remedy! Just lean back, don't freak out, and let Dr. Magi-Heal lend a helping hand.
Sure it's got some scratches and tape here and there, but it works just as well as Dr. Magi-Heal's pricier version. Is that creaking you hear as it raises and lowers? Probably just your imagination.

The Rustic Hallscape is the perfect platform on which to set books, keys, or the remnants of a sneeze. But, don't cough or leave such filth here as that is how plagues begin. Anyways! This is a fine table.
Before showing it off with a friend or two, be sure to check the glue, for poo on your shoe, and to praise the owner for this masterpiece, which is new.
Avast! Once you have your land legs back and a fine sandwich 'twixt two planks of bread, sally forth to the Lubber's Picknicker, a fine table if one ever was.

When heading outdoors to sup and sun, be sure to do so with this UV protecting Outdoor Patio Piece. Its 100% artisanal canvas material will shield you from all that ails you, assuming the ozone isn't shredded in the interim. Good luck!

When you find you have a minute or two, and your stomach feels like you might need to…do its business, look no further than the Copper Stopper. With sturdy post-bronze age piping and an elegant flusher, this commode is the best seat at the table.
It's tough to lose a furry friend, but at least this will let you keep the memory of them alive.
Laser Pointers are great fun for cats!
Place this podium and customers will gather around it to check their beloved pets in. It also has a place where you can put a logo, so you can brand it however you like.
So, it's a squeak toy, but THEY don't know that. Keep the age-old mystery going with this squeaky squeaker!
Your pet is a good pet and they deserve the finest of squeaker toys. With this yummy looking ball they will be busy till their heart is content.
This little squeaker will make any trip to the pier fun for your four-legged friend.
This squeaker toy is the most majestic of all toys. It will make your four-legged friend feel like they are part of a fairy tale.
This toy is perfect for the dog in your home who finds cats a bit much for their liking.
Sometimes it’s just nice to show those birds who's boss without harming a feather.
Want to allow your cats to hone their mice hunting skills? Look no further than this beauty right here.

My oh my, what marvelous treasures await your pet in Mr. Itchy's critically acclaimed Chest of Wonders. Not only does this toy chest come pre-stocked with a bouncy ball and a mystery squeaky toy, you can continue to fill it with your own pet toys until your furry friend begs you; "No Human! Please! No more toys! I've had enough glee for one day. Can't you see my hocks grow weary and my jaw grows tight?"
Don't be caught in any open grassy space without a Play On-The-Go-Toybox within paw's reach. This durable, resilient chest is packed with Pandora's box of playtime goodies.

Oh my pawd! There are squishy toys and balls and bones all strewn hither and yon. Tuck them away for safe squeaking in this Outdoor Pet Storation Device. It's sure to cloud all pet toys from inclement sun and moon rays.
A big treat for a gluttonous pet.
Cooler than Liquid Nitrogen Nutrition Bar
Treat to show love to any pet... or to bribe some pets that are not too fond of you.
Known for beautiful bright blooms every spring, dogwoods are often the best in show at festivals and barbecues. If you listen closely, you may even hear the branches howling in the wind.
The mighty maple tree stands as a symbol for strength and endurance. Be sure to plant enough; may you never run out of its rich maple syrup.
Once a favorite in the making of canoes, the bark of the white birch stands out gracefully against the contrast of its dark leaves.
An urn to keep your dearest pet friends nearby even after they are gone.

This temperature-controlled medicine vending device keeps everything inside at perfect, stable temperatures. The intelligent dispensing system will automatically grab and deliver a customer's requested item, saving you the cost of hiring an employee!

While the exterior may be dirty and chipped, rest assured, the interior functions exactly the same as the Dr. Magi-Heal's more expensive version. Hasn't anyone told you it's what's inside that counts?

Walls are oppressive, single minded, binary fixtures that close off views and minds to the greater outside world. The Greater Wall Hole seeks to enlighten walls, and customers, with its breathtakingly open feature of glass panes.

Walls are oppressive, single minded, binary fixtures that close off views and minds to the great outside world. The Great Wall Hole seeks to enlighten walls, and customers, with its breathtakingly open feature of glass panes.

This minuscule window is so small its name cannot even be pronounced correctly. Instead of fighting our grammatical urges, we thought more openly, and in an effort to be transparent, merely named it the Tiny Winder.
When space is tight but you need some light, use this classic with a four-panel design.
When space is tight but you need some light, use this classic with a cross-shape design.

The Port Hole Pane is inspired by a rather strange ship, from a rather strange time, and a rather strange architect. Concern yourself not with 18th century nautical tales, and steer hard to starboard towards this well-rounded window fixture.
Add some zest to any wall or window arrangement with this understated half-moon window.
If eyes are the windows to the soul, then windows are the eyes of your… house. Use this grand window to survey the sea and keep an eye out for turbulent waters.
Who needs glass? Let that ocean breeze cascade into your home with this beautifully crafted open archway.
Not quite a skylight, given its more vertical tendencies, this luxurious portal will bathe any room in the seafoam glow of the shore.

When a local elder attempted to restore this priceless collection of landscape paintings, things didn’t exactly go as planned. Rather than revealing her disastrous finger-paintings, she opted instead to ditch the art entirely and fill the frames with single-pane glass.

Local designer Boozer Pawson believes there is no truer art than a good dog, and that a good dog can be found in practically anything. “Take for instance, these three windows,” Boozer once exclaimed. “I can see three good dogs sitting in them right now!” It’s unclear whether he was referencing the beagle, Australian shepherd, and Portuguese water dog sitting on the opposite side of the glass, or going for some sort of artistic metaphor, but our marketing team preferred the latter.
With so many individual panes, this window arrangement is sure to make any room lit. All your friends will be saying, “Wow, this is so lit. Like, literally. So lit.”
With gorgeous porches, a backyard swimming pool, and a phenomenal view of the Brindleton Light, this Dutch colonial is one of the most admired properties in the Bay.

While Supriya loves her full-time job as a stay-at-home mom, it’s been getting harder and harder to suppress her dreams of being a full-fledged veterinarian. Especially now that the owner of the Brindleton Pawspital is looking to sell the business. Her husband Justin has always been supportive, and keeps offering to take a break from work so she can follow her dream. But can Supriya really trust him to keep the peace at home between Blue and Bartholomew? Not to mention Pierce and Evie too!
Easy access to the creek below makes this property a must-own for nature-loving homebuilders. You don’t want to wait for your life to be over- purchase this property and get building!
Tucked away between the expensive mansions of Cape Cavalier is this humble little cottage. Nothing says “beach access” like living right on the beach!
The largest property in Brindleton Bay- and with its very own private beach - Hound’s Head has housed a variety of rich and powerful pets (and their owners) through the ages.
The Hindquarter Hideaway may be the furthest property from the water’s edge, but the small fishing pond nearby more than makes up for it.
Once a part of the pet food cannery next door, this warehouse has since been converted into a stellar two-story home.
From sailors to spaniels to Scottish folds, the Salty Paws Saloon is a neighborhood staple and a favorite hangout spot for locals, human or otherwise.
Previously an exclusive yacht club for only the richest citizens of Brindleton Bay, a recent decree by Mayor Whiskers opened up this pool and wedding locale for public use.
Smackdab in the middle of Whiskerman’s Wharf, this modest home is absolutely perfect for someone who can’t get enough of the frenetic felines that hang out by the docks.

Cats in the neighborhood know where to go for a good meal. Catarina’s always had a soft spot for animals, and the cats she lives with have the best home a cat could ask for. Sometimes Catarina asks herself if there’s something more to life than cats… usually right before she adopts another stray.
Far from the bustle of the dockyards, this secluded lot still has plenty of that harbor charm (and a beautiful view to boot!)

After almost two centuries as the lighthouse keeper’s private home, this property was converted into a museum chronicling the Bay’s interesting maritime history when a new automated system was installed in the Brindleton Light.
A series of renovations have restored this mid-century house to its former glory. All houses are good houses, but this one is especially good.
A charmingly classic home steps away from the heart of Sable Square, Domus Familiaris is the ideal abode for a new family moving to the Bay.

Life in their new home seems to agree with newlyweds Brent and Brant. The small-town bustle inspires Brent’s painting, and Brant loves to explore the Bay's beautiful neighborhoods. But will they ever agree on who gets to take their beloved Rosie with them?
Central and affordable, this property is just waiting to be developed.

This state-of-the-art facility offers the very best in pet care for your sick barker or meower. Rumor has it the owner is preparing for retirement soon and is interested in selling the place to a young aspiring vet.
Featuring a playground for their two-legged kids and an obstacle course for their four-legged ones, it’s no wonder Brindletonians spend so many of their afternoons in this quaint public park.

As {0.SimFirstName} and {1.SimFirstName} get to the lighthouse, they notice the old man once again working diligently.

"Oh, that old story," the man mutters, as if he can't be bothered. "Some say the pooch belonged to Mr. Friendly, who used run this lighthouse. That it still haunts it today! Unfinished business or some nonsense. But I've never seen nor heard it for as long as I've been here." By his slow movements, {0.SimFirstName} assumes that's quite some time.

"It was a sad day, indeed," the old man replies. The man running the lighthouse at the time - one Mr. Friendly - had taken his dog to the vet, forgetting that a cargo ship was docking that night.

 Should {0.SimFirstName} let {1.SimFirstName} jump or encourage him to stay on the surface?

These Sims tend to make cats their companions, preferring the company of cats to other Sims.
These Sims love to be near dogs. They will gain relationships faster with dogs and socialize with dogs more than the average Sim.
These cats are more active than other cats. They really like to pounce and run around.
These dogs are very energetic. They really like running and enjoy frequent walks.
These dogs will be more hostile when greeting others and might attack others unless properly trained.
These cats are fairly protective of their territory. They will be aggressive to anyone new they meet.
These cats are more curious about their surroundings. They like to search different objects around the house.
These dogs are naturally more curious and like to investigate different objects around the house.
These pets tend to be Friendly to other Sims, and will happily greet other Sims around them.
These pets will eat significantly more often, and much more messily!
These cats are more fluffy than normal! They'll hack up hairballs more often.
These dogs will leave hair piles laying around. Brush their fur to keep things tidy!
These cats enjoy prowling around the neighborhood. Send them out and they might come back with something they've found.
These dogs are natural hunters. Send them off into the world and they'll hunt and dig for things.
These cats don't really need owners, they're just here for the free food.
These dogs are less likely to need constant affection and can even walk themselves.
These cats really enjoy their catnaps. They also are less likely to jump from place to place since it takes too much effort.
These dogs are low-energy creatures that like to relax and unwind with their owners rather than run around.
These cats really love their owners. They'll try to stick close to them whenever possible.
These dogs want to be closer to their owners and love to be petted. They like to follow their owners around.
These cats are always up to no good! They will often misbehave and can even be encouraged to do so.
These dogs are always up to nothing good. They will often misbehave and can even be encouraged to do so.
These pets love toys and want to play all the time, even when they're not excited.
These cats are scared of everything. Okay well, almost everything. They also like to hide a lot.
These dogs are easily frightened, and like to hide more often. They will often shy away from things like fights.
These cats are fast learners, and some say that they can even understand Simlish when spoken to!
These bright dogs are easier to train and pick up tricks quickly. They might even understand Simlish!
These cats are spoiled creatures. Scolding them hardly ever changes their behavior.
These Dogs don’t like being told what to do. Scolding them doesn’t do much to change their misbehaviors, but you can try begging them to stop.
These cats love to yowl along with other Sims. They'll even try to sing upon request!
These dogs like to howl occasionally, and can even sing on command.
These cats enjoy wandering around the world, almost as if they were wild animals! But don't worry, they'll always come home for the food.
These dogs will sometimes leave the house to go on solo adventures, but are also happy to go on an adventure with their owner.

You’ll need at least 4 obstacle course objects to make a course, but you can put them down individually and pets will still play with them. But the real fun to be had is when you make your own obstacle course!

Once you’ve set up your course, click on any of the objects and select the “Run Obstacle Course with…” interaction, and then pick a pet you’d like to run the course with. Depending on your pet’s mood, your Sim’s Pet Training Skill, and some good old-fashioned luck, you might get a gold medal!

Want to get your cat or dog some exercise in a fun way? Set up an obstacle course in your backyard! \nThere are hoops to jump through, ramps to walk up, poles to weave through, tunnels to crawl in, and platforms to stand on!

Cats and Dogs are less complex than Sims. They have basic needs like Hunger, Bladder, and Affection/Play. As long as you feed them twice a day, take them out, and play with them on a regular basis, they will be content.

Cats and Dogs have a much smaller Emotional scale than Sims. Cats and Dogs will mostly be fine, but sometimes they will become uncomfortable. This means they need something. Try Clicking them and Asking Them "What's Wrong" to find out more information.
Cats and Dogs will try telling you they need something by barking or meowing with a helpful thought balloon to point you in the right direction. Be sure to pay attention to their thought balloons.
In addition to Traits, Pets also have unique sets of obsessions and fears. Two pets with the exact same traits might have totally different things that they’re fond of and afraid of!

Pets who are obsessed with certain things will get excited when that object is nearby or in use. On the other hand, pets who fear those objects won’t be too happy when your Sim uses them. Pay attention to your pet likes and dislikes to make your home comfortable for your furry friend.

When your dog indicates that it needs to go potty through whining at the door and thought balloons you will be able to Ask to Go Potty, and they will find an outdoor location to go. The more you encourage them to go outside and reprimand them for going potty indoors will teach them the proper location to go potty in the future.

When your dog has learned these tricks any Sim that has a good relationship with your dog can Command them to do these tricks. As you gain skill with Pet Training you will be able to teach and command more interesting tricks like Play Dead or have them Perform Tricks for passing Sims.
Dogs will need to be taught tricks individually, but you will be able to teach dogs any Tricks you know how to teach.

True to any Pet, the Cats and Dogs in The Sims 4 misbehave. You will see them scratching the furniture, drinking from puddles, or even playing in the trash. While you could let this behavior continue, it’s best to teach your pet to stop these behaviors. When you see your cat or dog misbehaving you will see the option to Lecture or Scold them about this misbehavior. Select one of those options and your Sim will reprimand the cat or dog for the selected misbehavior.
Each misbehavior will have to be reprimanded out separately, which will allow you to decide if a specific behavior is something you would allow your pet to continue doing.
While the change won’t be immediate you should see your pets misbehaving less after reprimanding them, and with enough reinforcement they will learn to not misbehave in such a way.

What is one of the best things about dogs besides the unconditional love and affection? Obviously training them to do tricks. With any adult aged dog you will be able to start training with simple tricks like Sit, Speak, and Lie Down.

Your customers will be rating your Vet Clinic’s service from 1 to 5 stars. These ratings will determine your Vet Clinic’s overall star rating, which influences how many patients will seek out your clinic. Read the “Vet Clinic – Ratings” lesson for more tips on how to effectively service your customers.

When you first arrive at your Vet Clinic lot you’ll be asked to transfer some funds to your business to cover basic operating expenses. To learn more about managing your money, read the “Vet Clinic – Funds” lesson.

You’ll need a functioning Vet Clinic before you can open for business. Luckily you have the latest and greatest in veterinary technology at your disposal. You’ll need to place at least one Examination Table, Vet Podium, and trash can. \nIt’s also a good idea to place a Surgery Station, Medicine Crafting Table, and Medicine Vending Machine to broaden the options available at your Vet Clinic. You’ll see both cats and dogs of all shapes and sizes come in once you open a Vet Clinic, so it’s good to be prepared for anything.

Sims can own and manage Vet Clinics to earn Simoleons. To purchase a Vet Clinic, use the Phone or Computer and select “Buy a Vet Clinic”. You can also use the Owned Businesses panel to buy a business. You can buy an existing Vet Clinic, or purchase any unoccupied lot and start from scratch.

Check out the Owned Businesses panel in the bottom right hand corner. This is where you open and close your Vet Clinic. You’ll find useful information and shortcuts that will help you customize and run your Vet Clinic here. You can even open your Vet Clinic while you’re not there and have your employees earn you money while you’re away!

If you decide you no longer want to own your Vet Clinic, you can offload it by using the “Sell Venue” button in the Vet Clinic Settings Panel. Your business’s funds will be added to the value of the lot and get refunded to your household. Once you’ve sold your Vet Clinic, it’ll continue to be run under new management, and you can even bring your own pet there for checkups and treatments!

Use the “Manage Employees” button on the Owned Businesses panel to quickly check the status of your employees. You can view their skills and current pay level, and see how satisfied they are with their employment. \nYou can use this panel to promote a worthy employee, punish an employee with a demotion, or outright fire a worker who isn’t working out.

Running a Vet Clinic by yourself is entirely possible, but it’s going to be hard to juggle practicing veterinary medicine and the business side of things. It’s a good idea to hire employees to do some works like treating patients, crafting medicines, and ickier tasks like mopping up the floor. \nSelect “Manage Employees” on your Owned Businesses Panel to view a list of Sims to hire. Review their skills and starting pay to determine if they’re a good match for your Vet Clinic. If you don’t like the list of applicants, simply try again later and new Sims might apply.
As your Vet Clinic becomes more successful and well known, you can unlock perks to hire additional Veterinarians using your Perk Points. See the “Vet Clinic – Perks” lesson for more details.

Vet Employees have 3 different skills that determine how well they work. Review these skills on the “Manage Employees” panel. If you can’t find the perfect Sim to hire, don’t worry! Employees will slowly gain skills over time as they work. The best way to raise an employee’s skills more quickly is to send them to after work training. Just be prepared to pay for it!

An employee’s satisfaction is raised by being paid appropriately for their skill level, receiving praise from their boss, and getting promoted. Berating your employees, demoting them, or working them for long hours without break will lower their satisfaction. If they get too upset, don’t be surprised when they quit!
Since your Sim is the boss, they have to manage their employees. Your Sim can check in on, praise, criticize, pay for training, promote / demote, or even fire each employee.

As a business owner, your funds are tracked separately from your normal household funds. Each business that you own has its own separate funds that are used to cover the business’s expenses. When you visit your business, you can simultaneously view your business’s funds in the Owner Businesses panel in the bottom right corner, along with your household’s funds in the bottom left corner.

You can click on the View Last Finances/View Shift Summary button on the Owner Businesses panel to get a detailed breakdown of your profits and expenses. Use this information to make strategic decisions about your business to help maximize profits.

Every action taken as an owner while at your business uses money from your business’s funds. This includes building on the lot, placing objects, paying your employees, purchasing advertising, and more. When you enter Build Mode, the money shown in the bottom left corner will switch to display your business funds that you’re building with. Finally, any money you earn from your business will be deposited into your business funds.

At any time, you can use the Venue Funds Transfer button near your household’s Simoleons in the bottom left corner to move money between your household and any of the businesses that you own. Within this panel, you can select the account you’re transferring from and to, and enter the amount of Simoleons you want to transfer.

There’s a chance that your business can go into debt if you don’t have enough money to pay your employees or you purchase advertising while low on funds. If your business doesn’t have enough money to pay its debts, you won’t be allowed to reopen your business until those debts have been cleared. Transfer money from your household to your business to cover your debts.

Perks have a direct impact on your Vet Clinic and your household’s Sims that you’re playing. Employees that you fire are not affected by Perks. Instead, employees can be improved separately by building their skills at various tasks. You can learn more about that in the “Vet Clinic – Employees” lesson.

Perks are the key to building more efficient Vet Clinics. They will allow you to make your Vet Clinic more profitable and popular. \nThere are a wide variety of perks to choose from. You can unlock the ability to hire additional Veterinarians, change supply quality, and even make pets less stressed during procedures.

Owners of Vet Clinics can earn Perk Points from running their Vet Clinic. \nPlayers can use those Perk Points to buy Perks which make the Vet Clinic more effective. You’ll find various Perks within the Owner Businesses panel in the bottom right corner of the screen.
Earning Perk Points is simple- examine and treat pets. Interacting with customers and their furry friends will also provide Perk Points. Employees will not earn Perk Points for you, so get to work!
Some Perks provide a temporary bonus, such as the ability to get an influx of extra patients. You can return to purchase these Perks again in the future once your original purchase runs out.

You can review details on the Vet Clinic’s rating by hovering over the star rating or clicking on the View Last Finances/View Shift Summary button. Review the summary of feedback to find out what is going well and what needs improvement.

Each customer will display a rating over their head while at the Vet Clinic. The pets will not have a rating over their heads, but you can easily find their owners by hovering over them. When you finish examining and treating a pet, the customer will leave a rating and it will be added to your overall Vet Clinic rating. Care kindly and efficiently for your customers’ pets to raise their rating!

Quality of care, supply quality, wait times, proper bedside manner, cleanliness, and Vet Clinic ambiance will all impact a customer’s rating. \nVeterinarians with high skills will provide better services and be more effective at treating pets. Make sure you have enough staff hired to keep your waiting room from piling up with sick pets.

Pay close attention to the icons of the Sim’s heads. They will show when the Sim’s rating of the Vet Clinic changes and indicate why. If you miss a change, the tool tip on each Sim will show their last bit of feedback.

Customers and their pets will enter the Vet Clinic while it is open, and will gather around the Check-in Podium. Your Vet Clinic’s overall rating and advertising will determine how many patients stop by and how much money you can earn. You can also purchase perks that increase the number of patients.

When your pet finally gets seen by a Veterinarian, you’ll need to wait patiently as they perform the proper exams and procedures. Once they finish, you’ll be prompted to choose a treatment option. The cheap option will always result in a cone of shame for your pet, which isn’t going to make them happy!
Once you get to the Vet Clinic, look for the Vet Podium so you can sign your pet in. Depending on how busy the Vet Clinic is, you might have to wait a bit for a Veterinarian to get to you.

Visiting a Vet Clinic is never the highlight of owning a pet, but sometimes your furry friend gets sick and you’ve got to get them treated! \nYou can also get your pet a checkup if you’re worried they might be sick but aren’t sure yet, or take them to the Vet Clinic for spaying and neutering.
Club Gathering at a Vet Clinic
Meet up with the Club at the Vet Clinic
Cure pets of various sicknesses or perform advanced surgeries at the Vet Clinic!
Known for its hiking trails and sprawling coastal properties, Cape Cavalier is the perfect place to go exploring or chase seagulls with an adventurous pup!
A favorite hangout for the Bay's feline citizens, who can often be found climbing around down at the docks, Whiskerman's Wharf is also enjoyed by fishermen and tourists alike.

Once the site of a mysterious shipwreck, Deadgrass Isle is now home to the world-famous Brindleton Light and the city's largest population of indigenous strays. Lately, however, there have been some rumors about strange visitors after sundown...
The cultural center of the city, Sable Square is ideal for both cats and dogs. These people love their pets so much, they've built a monument to them right in the middle of town!
